svg.text: McCzarny recently made significant updates to
his ghsummary project, notably adding a warning
to the README about its current
non-functionality due to GitHub API breaking
changes. He enhanced its API interaction logic,
implementing exponential backoff for LLM usage
and leveraging the GITHUB_TOKEN to improve
GitHub API rate limits. He also enabled
pagination for event retrieval and added
safeguards for commit summary failures. For
upload-image, he updated the cloudinary
dependency to version 2.8.0 and refreshed
internal modules. In chromium-daily-digest,
McCzarny focused on refining its AI-driven
summary generation. He increased Gemini API
retries for better reliability and adjusted
commit processing chunk sizes to optimize for
model limits. Custom instructions were updated
to filter specific Chromium areas and ignore
certain changes, while also increasing the
maximum number of pages for commit fetching. He
introduced a robust configuration system and
made improvements like continuing from the last
step on rate-limit errors. Project cleanup,
logo adjustments, and basic generator
functionality were also completed for
chromium-daily-digest. Additionally, he updated
the images repository with resized portraits,
new icons, and images.
Generated on: Thu Nov 13 16:51:36 2025
